title: Minor Fiora Buff
body:
So, I really like the Fiora Rework in concept. It's great, but it lacks a very important tool that Fiora absolutely needs to accomplish the fencer/duelist fantasy. She's supposed to be nimble, swift, and deadly right? So, why does she feel absolutely immobile? Your Q is short ranged, and if you use it to go in - You have nothing to get out. So, a minor suggestion that might help her 'duel' more, and be more useful in a fight.

Simply, if Lunge hits a vital, it resets completely. This will enable her a bit better trading in lane, darting in and out for quick procs of her passive, and will give her the necessary mobility to actually use her ultimate for more than the heal. Let's face it getting more than 2 of those marks off is nearly impossible as is. If it proves overbearing, numbers could be adjusted, but as is, her kit just does not have the mobility demanded of her.

replies.body:
We're with you that Fiora seems to be pretty underpowered and are working on a set of buffs for her at the moment. One of those will increase her mobility, overall though at least for a first set of changes we're looking more to add baseline effectiveness to her. From the look of it we ended up being significantly too cautious about her balance overall.

Current changelist (note, work in progress, so not set in stone) looks like this:

HP / level 80 >>> 92       
AD / Level 2.5 >>> 3.3      
Q CD 18/16/14/12/10 >>> 16/14/12/10/8
W CD 21/19.5/18/16.5/15 >>> 19/18/17/16/15
Any plans on giving her passive a jungling bonus, or to change the parry so it' s more comfortable to land ( twitch reaction + skillshot), or are you pretty much satisfacted with that?

Meddler, outside of her power level, I'm a bit worried about Fiora's team fight core gameplay.  Right now, the most practical way of playing Fiora in team fights is to use your ultimate on a focused or low target, get a single Vital off of them, and proc the extremely potent AoE heal for your team ASAP.  To me, this doesn't fulfill nor align with her playstyle fantasy, is not fun, and is not very interactive or dynamic.  Also, there's the clash where Fiora's ultimate gives a lot of true damage on a tank or burst on a squishy, both which Fiora wants to do, but it's more effective to use it on an already almost-dead target to guarantee the heal quickly; using it on a low target feels like a waste of potential damage, particularly when Fiora's damage and passive refreshes cannot keep pace in a team fight without it.  I don't mind that the ult gives an AoE heal, but I don't think it's executed well.  What are your thoughts on these views of the ultimate?

I was also worried about her identity and focus, as both her sustained and burst damage are not notable for her squishiness, her team fighting outside of her ultimate is not ideal, and her 1v1 ability mid to late game is very bad compared to upper tier split pushers.  But with a lower Q cooldown, she could fit better into doing sustained damage, which would help her split pushing.  I just wanted to bring up the issue of her role in the game, ask what you guys envision it as, and hope it's kept in mind when making her stronger.

I wonder if it'll actually be enough to do anything.  

It's not like her W, E, or R are pulling their weight.  You've jammed ALL her power into her passive and Q alone because you made W extremely restrictive in its usage (Long cooldown, directional, roots her while in use, short window, I mean, you did test this in the real world, right?) and required investment in E to make it any good.  R is only reliable if you activate it on an enemy that's just about to die so at least the heal gets off in a team fight, or to peel for real carries.

She doesn't hit a real power spike until around level 11-13 when she actually has her Q at a low enough cooldown to reliably pursue enemies and strike multiple vitals, has enough points in E that the critical damage is noticeable and the cooldown also isn't oppressive, and she's hopefully built up enough AD, sustain, and movespeed to have any hope at all of fighting.

And she won't get there because someone'll just pick any of the countless champions that can utterly shit on her at every stage of the game.

I was really hoping her kit would be the one redeeming part of her update, but nope.  People can't even figure out what to build on her any more since she seems to need every single stat except mana and AP just to become functional, and that's not possible.

The Q is pretty damn strong and annoying. Once she is stronger than you, she can chase you down with the perma Q and if you want to CC her or deal dmg back, the W will block all of it and even slow or stun you.

I played against good and bad Fioras around plat and the good ones rape you after some lvls.

You want an item builds? Phage -> Hydra -> T2 Boots (mercs most of the time) -> BotRK -> BC. 
Fiora wants AD most.
After that there are 3 options: BT, IE or GA (or Randuins or Banshees if you play against mostly one dmg source). BT is the natural choice because it agian gives you more HP and the LS on all these items is insane. IE does more dmg but is not needed.
Last item is probably LW. Can be built earlier

Phage -> Hydra -> mercs -> BotRK -> BC -> BT/IE/GA -> LW/GA

Fioras offensive stats: AD > AS > Crit. 
Crit is not really good on her or needed. It never was. 
AS is ok, but BotRK is more than a simple AS item. It gives AD, LS, the passive and active. She doesn't like pure AS items.

Quints can be AD or AS, both is good. reds are AD.
CDR in the mastery tree. Definitely spell weaving and blade weaving.


And to Riot: If these buffs are going throug, I can see a lot of good Fiora players stomping lanes everywhere.
I see a lot of people getting Triforce before BotRK which is crap. No BC (phage) for the follow up MS after you hit a vital spot and they never get enough CDR to spam the Q. The bad ones nearly always use the W active instead of reactive (sometimes it is oks to use it actively). And the E is an AA reset, use it right.

The HP per lvl buff combined with the W CD buff is nice and OK. But the AD per lvl buff is probably too much and Q doesn't need an even lower CD late game. Early 2 sec less is ok, even 4 sec would be still fine I think.

I really don't think using a build identical to her pre-rework one is a good idea, as that is the build you're suggesting, but if it works for you then it works for you.  I didn't like it in my testing, personally, and I haven't run into a good Fiora yet so the jury's out there.

This post was made after about ONE day of Fiora being available.

How in God's name is this even CLOSE to the amount of time it should take to know if a champ isn't good? Don't get me wrong, she very well might need buffs, but this is definitely not enough time for you to go, "Yeah we're with you. She REALLY needs it." Everyone and their dog lost as Yasuo when he was released too, and he turned out to be one of the most infuriating champs to ever face. You guys like to say the PBE is a very small set of people, so not all data can be brought from it, but what about the countless threads of people SAYING they played it. The ones recommending buffs and nerfs to the champions? The ones that MAIN the champion you're looking into? The only one I've seen get noticed on any of the recent things is MarineRevenge. People like myself that make threads about the new Skarner and such that have played him forever get neglected 90% of the time. The PBE seems like it's just a way of saying "This is who is being buffed/nerfed, these are the new skins. No we're not going to change it if you don't like it (Maybe in a patch of 2 after it's live)."

I really don't like how the the buffs and nerfs to champions have been getting determined lately. It really feels like you guys don't listen ot a lot of us. But when it's ONE DAY after a rework, you're already ready to buff Fiora. There is no consistency.
My question would be, why are you raising the base AD again? I thought that stat was deliberately reduced to lower her synergy with Triforce, and thus the burst she can put out.

Then you have to ask, is it really her stats that need raised, or is it going to be another case of a character being too strong when the stats are good, and to weak if the stats get nerfed?

The whole point was to make her more cohesive and consistent of a champion, but this is the opposite, nothing in her kit works together.

Her q makes her dance around the target and gives her movespeed if she hits her passive, doing decent damage.  Her w stops damage and cc, and is pretty hard to time right.  Her e is auto attack reliant, which slows, but the problem with it is that you're auto attacking for that time, which means you aren't moving for those two auto attacks.

Then you have your r, which is overloaded with damage, that you just can't ever pull off.  Then it has a heal?  And once again, the heal is set near the place your enemy died, meaning if you want to use it, you better hope the team fight stays right there.  In one spot, which is not thematic to the character at all.

At this point in time, it's actually more useful to use your ult on an enemy you don't want to kill, to catch up with an enemy you do.  Because once you kill the first enemy, you lose the speed and the enemy team isn't sticking around in the heal all your allies field.

I'm not against change, especially seeing how broken a fed fiora could be pre rework.  But why would you make a jumping around duelist have 3 spells that require her to stop the battle from moving.  How about make it to where her q breaks the opposite sides vital point during the ult.  And decrease the damage of her vital point slightly.  That way you're getting the damage, and just forget about the heal, any burst make is just going to break through the heal anyway.  Or make it a less powerful heal, and have it only heal you as a H.O.T.

These are all good ways to make her  strong without making her stop to have full affect.

"The whole point was to make her more cohesive and consistent of a champion, but this is the opposite, nothing in her kit works together"

This. She just feels thrown together. No synergy between her spells. When the ult is up you really can't waste time to use your W or E. If you do, you waste so much valuable time. She feels gimped from her own kit.

I don't think Fiora is very weak in those areas, though it would help. My biggest issue with Fiora is her laning phase, build path, and her passive. Against any champion with waveclear, she struggles to keep up until she gets Tiamat, but by rushing Tiamat, you must forgo any defensive stats, mobility items, or lifesteal (until you finish hydra,) and by that time it's not hard to just have your lane shoved into you constantly with no chance of actually interacting with your opponent. And of course by having Tiamat, you forfeit your ability to manipulate minion waves as well as you could without it.

Her passive is mostly random and literally decides if Fiora can play up or not depending on if it decides to show towards Fiora or away from her, and if the opponent doesn't like the side it's on, they can just walk away from Fiora and reset the passive until it's favorable, then Fiora has nothing to play off of for 15 seconds.

I think she's fine full build, but her lack of laning power forces her into a build path that's not optimal just to keep up. I would be happy with a buff to her Q that just let it hit multiple targets in a line, like a Yasuo Q. It would give it another dimension to master, not just having to be in range, but attacking from the right angle to line up multi hits. I think it would be really fun and would help Fiora just enough to deal with minion waves, and maybe even jungling.

Buffs are needed, but there is a bigger problem Meddler. I like her kit, but not her ult. I'm not sure how to make it work and I have tested it plenty in real games. In 1v1's it can be strong, it takes a while but as long as the opponent doesn't have a way to hard disengage you and just wait it out it's ok. Plenty do though.

But in team fights, unless your team is ahead, for a fighter that builds damage items positioning on team fights is everything, because you don't want to step into AOE or get in range of all their carries at once and get bursted down too fast. Her ult requires you to focus your positioning on burying your face into an opponent for an extended period of time. I feel like she has to be a lot more tanky for this to be usable in team fights, but her currently scaling require her to build a lot of AD to matter. So you're relying on your teammates to kill your target fast enough to get the heal field off and even then...

The heal field is strong but people move around a lot in team fights, even it if goes off which requires already a lot of things to work out, for it to help you would need the team fight to still be going on while it's up AND for enough teammates to be fighting on it, so if the enemy is running away, or their priority target just simply moves out of it your team just won't get much healing since they have to go to where those targets are.

Here is what it comes down to. Ults are on long CD's and for this reason across the board they are designed to be nearly always impactful, you can still lose the fight but they always do something substantial unless you mess up badly. The contribution and effectives of her ult is very situational, even if you play it well, it too often can have no or minimal impact due to too many constraints. It's just not what I want to see in an ult, it's supposed to be a high moment for a champ and it just doesn't feel that way.

Personally I really enjoy the new Fiora, she is fun to play but I do agree that her mobility is lacking for a squishy champions with no range, her ult is weird (but I do enjoy it, the numbers are weird), and W/E could use slight buffs on CD's. I'll just leave a list of changes that I think could help Fiora.

**Buffs** (not all of these changes are necessary just some ideas, even 1 would help her vastly)

* Let her Q reset (only once in a short time window) if she strikes a vital, if they chose not to use the reset during the short window it does it's normal 60% cooldown reduction and if she uses it to just escape or after the reset Q it goes on its normal cd. So good Fiora's have options they can either hit 2 Q's in quick succession or hit the one on the 60% CD which would be better for Ult situations. This gives Fiora strong in and out like a real fencer, increases her dps, and makes her ult easier to pull off in teamfights.

* Give her W a passive where either she avoids unit collision or gains bonus movement speed when approaching an enemy champion.

* Make W a like less static.

**Nerfs**

* Not really a nerf as much as a fix. Improve the AD scaling of the heal on her ult and lower the base heal. Tank Fiora OP.
I really like that idea of letting fiora manually do with her ult what used to be automatic.

I have a lot of games with old Fiora, probably over 500. I made it to plat with her.

After a dozen games with the rework I only have a few comments.

1. CD's feel way too high, players will only take one level on W and it's 22 second CD. I get that it's dangerous to completely block an enemy spell too often, but odds are you are only ever going to land it on an auto anyways. I would like to see it's CD cut in half if it blocks an auto attack, if it blocks a spell it gets the full CD.
2. I like the passive. With Q it's fun to harass in lane and it has good damage. The problem is it causes minions to agro, so even though you did good damage you will still lose the trade most of the time. Passive procs need a bit better healing early.
3. Even though you can Q harass a lot and be ahead in trades, there is no way to all in for the kill. Going for a combo into your ult just takes way to long. Most of the times I engaged with a very clear advantage I ended up chasing the enemy to their turret with 2 out of 4 vitals proc'ed and nothing I could do. I don't really have a solution for this one.

So far I've only had success with Fiora if the enemy actually tries to fight you. This lets you actually use W (since it roots you) and you can maneuver better. If the enemy has an escape you probably won't ever kill them without flash up.
Her e feels like it has a bit too long cd especially early on  maybe put it at 11 base cd and lower by 1 per rank

Compensate it with some nerfs to her broken ultimate heal. It wins teamfights alone. Because of it, people play tank Fiora just to use the base heal which is stupidly high. Nerf the bases here because who thought that 700 would be balanced? I feel like it should be 20/30/40 (+150% bonus AD) per second, resulting into 100/150/200 (+750% bonus AD). This would also make building AD vital if you want to use the heal efficiently. Also, for a squishy Fiora, it is harder to proc the Vitals than a tanky one, so you get rewarded for a harder to land heal.
